column4: Anyone know why my systems like to do this sometimes: the disk drive for /dev/sdc5/ is not yet ready or not present Press S to skip mounting
is it connected via usb ?
No it's a fixed disk
It's a partition on the boot disk.
I assume that there are no similar problems with the rest of partitions on sdc ? What do you use sdc5 for ? Is it for data or swap ?
swap
I choose M and then ctrl-alt-delete rebooted it and it did boot ok. I'm not sure though if this was a fluke. You think the disk may be corrupt?
check with smartctl -a /dev/sdc
look for "Current pending sectors or reallocated ... "
not installed, but in diskutility it is very unhappy
what exactly do you mean ?
red text for read errors. I am trying to locate the text you described in it
Yes, the value you mention is in WARNING
and what is the counter value ?
worst 88, treshold 0,value 4 sectors
then, there is not much you can do. It will be worse and worse
the drive needs to be replaced
Yes, i guess.
a partial solution would be to disable the partition swap and replace it with a file swap
dagon666:That swap is only 2.5gb of a 1Tb drive. Wich is also my OS. I think i better change it.
for the good of your data you MUST change it but temporarily to get over those mount problems I suggest you to not use the swap partition and if it is neccessary use a swap file instead
